### Mitigation, Alleviation, Reduction, Minimization, Therapy, Intervention, Remediation, Healing, Treatment, Cure, Remedy in Gaucher Disease

#### Case Presentation
- A 35-year-old man suffered from Gaucher disease (GD) with hepatosplenomegaly, ascites, bone destruction, myelofibrosis, and membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis (MPGN).
- He received treatment with oral prednisone and mycophenolate mofetil.
- His ascites and renal outcomes significantly improved.

#### Therapy and Treatment
- Therapy included oral prednisone and mycophenolate mofetil.
- These therapies may be optional for patients with Gaucher disease who cannot use enzyme treatment.

#### Conclusions
- Prednisone and mycophenolate mofetil therapy can be considered for Gaucher disease patients lacking access to enzyme treatments.
- This treatment approach led to significant improvements in the patient's condition.
